intro: Sicyos bryoniifolius, commonly known as the giant bryony, is a climbing vine native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are spiny, spherical berries that contain toxic seeds. Due to its invasive nature, it is considered a problematic weed in some regions.
